page.title: 12Castle Gotha,Porthpean
page.content: Most of the prehistoric fortifications in Cornwall were made by Iron Age Celts.These fortifications are of two types,cliff castles and true hill forts.Traces of about 22 cliff castles and 27 hill forts can still be seen. Most of the smaller forts are situated on undulating ground,between 200 and 400 feet above sea level.Castle Gotha, near St.Austell is among one of these castles to be found in Cornwall. Covering about one and a half acres between Porthpean and Pentewan its defences were erected before 100 B.C. and its occupation continued well into the second century A.D. The inhabitants lived in timber huts in the Lee of the ramparts and included metalworkers who penannular bracelets. Parts of a tin ingot mould was found in the floor of one of the huts.
